[color=white][b]Interview Requests Live[/b][/color]
At long last, a medium to apply for an interview has been created. Head over [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4110312]here[/url] for more information or to throw in an application.

[color=white][b]The Respawn of Respawn[/b][/color] 
Led by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=657392][color=#EFEFEF][b]Astonish[/b][/color][/url] and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1839274][color=#EFEFEF][b]Skitlz[/b][/color][/url], the usergroup Respawn has once again returned to the forum. With the return of Respawn, the group Innovation has been removed. Being a group focused on gaming, it will require potential members to be dedicated gamers. On the application form, there are multiple questions for each system, being PC, PlayStation, and Xbox. A few questions concerning experience with the game League of Legends are also included. The recruitment will accept new members as applications are posted, with the recruitment being closed on March 20th. Within the group, there will be multiple sectors members may join upon acceptance. The recruitment thread can be viewed [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4104863]here[/url].

[color=white][b]Viral Dragon's Second Campaign[/b][/color]
Hack Forums' very own [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=23809][color=#00AAFF][b]Viral Dragon[/b][/color][/url] has not been having the best year. Since early 2013, he has begun having occasional seizures. After the continued reappearance of these seizures, it was decided to pay the hospital a visit in order to find out what was causing these disruptions, which turned out to be a lesion in his brain, as determined by the results of a CAT scan and an MRI. At a mere 1.3cm in size, it doesn't seem all that large, but his neurosurgeon still believes that it is the root cause of the seizures. Even though medication against the return of the seizures helps, they also have side effects, including severe irritation, affecting his culinary classes. Several other problems have also arisen over time, including light sensitivity and trouble concentrating. Viral Dragon has been a member of Hack Forums for over four years at this point, sharing his knowledge to others completely free of charge. Being a mentor, he is relentless in keeping Hack Forums a good place to be. Now the roles are reversed; Viral Dragon is the one who needs help. On the [url=http://igg.me/at/formattsmind/x/6004504]second Indie GoGo[/url] campaign started by his significant other, several ways of how members can help out are described, from sharing his story on social media to helping them diagnose the lesion and hopefully improving the quality of his life.

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076]Reset[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#75EBB2][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to 185th edition of the HF News, today we're here with Reset. Any shout-outs you'd like to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076][color=#EFEFEF][b]Reset:[/b][/color][/url] What an honor, sure here's a few people. 630, Vinnie, TheCause, AWHTY, and Sudsy.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#75EBB2][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for the shoutout! That's a pretty interesting mix of people. So tell us a little about yourself, how did you stumble across Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076][color=#EFEFEF][b]Reset:[/b][/color][/url] A little about me, I'm a furry artist and my real name is Yano and I hail from Sweden. I originally found HF in 2009 while searching for a couple of new exploits and I really enjoyed the forum, unfortunately I lost access to my original account and it seems it either got merged and deleted so I made a new account called Reset since I was in the middle of resetting a password and needed a new username.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#75EBB2][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] That's an interesting story. I see you always have some pretty interesting furry artwork displayed on your profile, are you the artist of those?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076][color=#EFEFEF][b]Reset:[/b][/color][/url] Unfortunately my current avatar isn't my work, I had to recently remove all my artwork from my profile which included a comic signature sliced up and animated to show scenes of my 3 most popular comics, but I'm relatively famous in the furry art world and it lead to some very disturbing and threatening confrontations with members and fans that overstep my privacy and I felt that I should remove it. My artwork generally revolves around gay furry comics and gay furry characters, but you occasionally see other pieces of art from me. Far as my fans know me to be, I'm a pretty kind and shy person that gets easily backed into a corner by rumors and because of this I needed to take a vacation from my work. Currently I draw using my other various aliases, but a person named Nathan seems to be stalking me constantly, even attempting to barge into my privacy and I'm forced to deal with him a lot so I haven't had much time to draw lately.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#75EBB2][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Being famous in the furry world, can't say I envy you on that one. From what I've heard the furry community has some diehard fans. You were big into Hacker Craft, even a moderator member at one point in time, are you still playing Hacker Craft?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076][color=#EFEFEF][b]Reset:[/b][/color][/url] I can't say I envy myself either, the fame was unwanted, but my fans seemed so kind at first and they slowly became vicious and unreasonably demanding as I started answering their questions one by one. I imagine any fandom has some diehard fans, but I can speak from experience and say that some of them are very diehard and even fit the stereotypes, but in their defense about the stereotype very little fit that, they're just extremely dedicated to the furry fandom. I suppose it's fair to say I was big into HackerCraft given my previous position, I played on the server for 3 weeks and immediately received the moderator position after a message from Omniscient asking if I would be interested. It was a very overwhelming responsibility at first as Omni scared the kittens out of me and failing him seemed like a very bad idea for me, but I quickly realized that a serious attitude isn't really needed and I quickly became a silly goofball moderator with the nickname Yoshi that everyone either hated or loved, but mostly loved. I don't mean to have an arrogant tone, but I think people really enjoyed my time spent as a moderator and I kept the place running like clockwork since my currently job allows me a lot of free time for hobbies and such, but after 6 months the headaches and troubles that came with it made me realize I needed a vacation. I stepped down from moderator position last month and I occasionally have regrets about it as I hear that the health of the server slowly started decreasing and it's hard for me to get on anymore and see how unresponsive staff are to the server anymore, I partially blame myself for stepping down, but I'm only human and can do only so much. Currently I rarely get on the server anymore, most of the original friends I had on there left and the 666 faction is still alive and well, but recent dramas and problems have made the server very mundane for me.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#75EBB2][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well I'm sorry to hear that you left Hacker Craft thinking less of the server, as a player I do miss your moderation. Outside of Hack Forums what do you like to do? Are there any particular hobbies or sports you participate in?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076][color=#EFEFEF][b]Reset:[/b][/color][/url] Drawing is one of my constant hobbies, but I also enjoy sampling and brewing new and different types of tea leaves and flavors and I also enjoy 3D printing and I'm in the process of ordering a MakerBot Replicator 3D desktop printing machine so I can start printing out things like some of my favorite video game characters and possibly even some of my cast in the furry comics. I honestly have far too many hobbies to list and I'm constantly juggling them as the idea of boredom for me is a fate worst than death, but I also enjoy Basketball and Football (US Soccer) since you asked, even though I'm pretty bad at Football (US Soccer) and fairly decent at Basketball.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#75EBB2][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Having a 3D printer sounds pretty fun, but expensive. What would you end up doing with the toys you make from it?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076][color=#EFEFEF][b]Reset:[/b][/color][/url] I'll probably keep them honestly and maybe show them to friends and people that are interested, doubt I can sell the, but I'm fairly skilled in 3D modeling and I know that I could create almost anything I have in mind and I'm sure people will probably want to purchase some from me. I imagine that answer is going to make people laugh at me and feel disgusted that I would spend $3000 on personal entertainment like that, but money has very little personal value to me and if it's not used to entertain me somehow or benefit me I often leave it in my bank. I'm a rather strange one and I believe that boredom is the ultimate sin in life and that's why I don't mind buying something like that for a somewhat pointless reason, but those characters meant a lot to me as a child and it's worth the pretty penny to bring them into the real world for me so I don't mind.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#75EBB2][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] eah that sounds like a pretty big investment to me, but it's a hobby so I hope it works out for you. Do you have any Hack Forums related goals?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076][color=#EFEFEF][b]Reset:[/b][/color][/url] Honestly no and maybe that's why I like Hack Forums, when the days almost all over and I get tired and my insomnia allows me to sleep finally, I usually take a break from my other hobbies and browse the forum looking at all the fun new post and boundless stupidity and entertainment that HF provides.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#75EBB2][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] The last question I've got for you today is what would you like to see changed or improved on Hack Forums.
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076][color=#EFEFEF][b]Reset:[/b][/color][/url] I'd like for people to realize that groups are just groups and nothing more. It doesn't make you better than anybody else and it's not special to be in a group regardless of how exclusive it is, I find that people often try hiding who they really are in an attempt to impress people and they quickly realize how pathetic their attempts are. I would like peoples perspective on groups to change honestly, you're every bit HQ and cool as any other member regardless of your group status, don't be that fool that joins a group forcibly trying to agree with ideas of how things should be so you don't get kicked out, the groups that allow you to be yourself regardless of who you may be are the groups that you should join. I'm in Instinct and it's the only group I'm in, I understand by far that they're not seen as the most HQ envied group, but I'd rather be here with my friends while being myself than sitting in another group putting on a facade so I can stay in it, Instinct respects the ideas of being yourself and showing off a little group class, I wish that other groups could adopt this idea and I wish that people could see that their value or worth on this forum isn't affected by a shiny userbar, it's all about who you are that matters.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#75EBB2][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I couldn't agree with you more on the last statement. I just want to say thanks for letting me interview you Reset, do you have any final words for us?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=417076][color=#EFEFEF][b]Reset:[/b][/color][/url] Remember to be yourself and as Klonoa would say....WAHOO!!!!
[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color]  Welcome to this weeks edition of the HF News. How's it going man? How arr ya?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] Im doing great, just got back from a homies pad and made $100 today.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] No lie. Anyone that you'd like to give a shout out to before we begin?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] Sure, why not, shout out to AlreadyCoded, Tiszy, Cyph Jr, all my Instinct fam, Froggy (Saw your birthday alert on Skype), and anyone else that fucks with me.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Coolio. Tell us about yourself dude. What does thousands even do?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] I just browsed until about december and started Paypal holding and kind of managing a stresser, other than that i hang around the sellers section, gaming section, and currency exchange.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] How'd you like the stresser type of business? I tried making one with a bud ages ago. Didn't work out the way we planned. üòï
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] I myself hate the purpose of stressers, but they can turn into a total honeypot and rake in a ton of revenue. Sorry that you didn't get a chance to earn big bucks. üòù

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Do what ya gotta do to make money. Anyways. What made you sign up on the forum in the first place?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] II had a couple friends that would rat other members on Runescape to make money off items and gold, i never played Rs but i was still fascinated by the idea of ratting. I signed up last summer and made a lot of friends who knew there way around rat's and botnet's. I just fell out of it because i never really thought there was an easy way to make money from it. Other than that i changed from Blackhat to Greyhat when i started making steady profit from more legal methods.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Interesting. What do you do outside of all that? Off the internet. Are you currently employed?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] Not currently employed, currently attending Highschool and do a little computer repair work for this small community some relatives live in. Mostly virus removal and pc cleanup, I've been looking to check out the Whitehat and malware removal section one of these days.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] That's pretty neat, dude. Any thoughts about what you're going to be doing a few years from now?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] yeah thanks man, and I honestly have close to no idea. Maybe aim to become a stock broker, real estate agent, or start something of my own. who knows, check back in 10 years.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] True that. Anyways, what music are you into?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] Rap, I'm a total hip-hop head and like anything from old school to modern. Some favorites being MF DOOM, Schoolboy Q, 275, De La Soul, Drake, Kanye West, Chief Keef, and Joey Bada$$.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Speaking of SchoolBoyQ. What'd you think of his latest album? (Oxymoron) I thought it was Pretty different for his style -- not bad.
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] Its overall not that bad, some better than others but i truly think he took his time and is very talented.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Most def. What do you think of the site as a whole? Anything you'd change if you had the chance?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] I think the Hackforums community is hilarious and awesome, most people treat others very friendly and you can thrive in the marketplace. Other than little things here and there i would probably have admins look a little more into some scam reports and create consequences for those who are proven to scam.

[b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FFA500]Clique:[/url][/b][/color] Glad you're havin' a good time man. We've came to the end of our interview. Any closing statements?
[color=white][b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1852076]Thousands[/url]:[/b][/color] Thanks to you for the interview and the rest of the news team for there contribution to this forum. Have a good one everybody.
[/spoiler]

[color=white][b]Large Data Breach in South Korea[/b][/color]
Recently in South Korea there has been news of an ongoing data breach which has lasted over a year. Hackers have stolen thousands of personal details from a South Korean telecom company. The data was then sold for well over $10 million USD. This data breach is only the most recent of hackings within South Korea, with a major one coming prior in January. Thus far, three men have been arrested and South Korea has shown they have no intentions of letting things like this go, even punishing credit card companies in the past. The data which was compromised is likely being used by telemarketers, so there may be a large influx of strange texts and calls for many people around the world.

[color=white][b]Facebook Blocked from WhatsApp Data?[/b][/color]
Facebook recently acquired a new shiny company, and more importantly set of data. With the constantly growing database of Facebook, this is a good change to obtain a true plethora of information; however, this has many security advocates reeling. The Electronic Privacy Information Center among other groups have filed a complaint to the Federal Trade Commission of the United States to try to block this blockbuster deal. Their claim reads as, "We do not use your mobile phone number or other Personally Identifiable Information to send commercial or marketing messages without your consent or except as part of a specific program or feature for which you will have the ability to opt-in or opt-out." While this is just the basis of things, they are also pushing the idea of blocking the data obtained by WhatsApp. Their claim is based on the fact that previously WhatsApp did not collect data, and their hallmark of security was that they only saved messages for thirty days. Therefore, users could have not willingly given their data to Facebook. While this complaint is mainly trying to protect former data, anything from the time Facebook actually acquires WhatsApp and changes the TOS is theirs. Facebook is a company who willingly admits they collect, use, sell, and giveaway data.

[color=white][b]The Hybrid Economy: A Marriage of Fiat and Bitcoin[/b][/color]
Bitcoin has had its fair share of detractors who will swear fiercely by fiat currencies. However, an op-ed published on Coindesk by Sean Neville suggests that a hybrid economy may be the way of the future for both Bitcoin and fiat currencies. Citing a demonstration by Alan Shapiro in which he analyzed the cost of exchanging $1,000 in USD for Euros for a merchant would cost approximately $50 by credit card, and $80 by bank wire. If the equivalent amount were exchanged at both ends, it would cost approximately $15 in fees, a fraction of what it would cost by traditional payment methods. Perhaps Bitcoin isn't here to replace fiat, but instead to turn it into fiat v2. You can see the entire op-ed by clicking [url=http://www.coindesk.com/forget-bitcoin-vs-fiat-welcome-hybrid-economy/]here[/url].

[color=white][b]SCEA's President and CEO to Step Down, New Leadership for PlayStation America[/b][/color]

Fixes found in this update are improvements of the party system, matchmaking system, the friend's list, and the user interfaces associated with them. Shortly after the release of the Xbox One console in November 2013, Larry Hryb (Xbox Live's "Major Nelson") announced that there would be fixes to the console's major issues. Four months later, these fixes are finally released in this month's update. The update was released on March 4, 2014 in order to be out for consoles in time for the release of the highly anticipated game, Titanfall, which comes out on March 11. Here's a breakdown of the major features and improvements, detailed from the Xbox Wire: 

[list]
[*][b]Get to your friends list faster.[/b] The friends list is now front and center on the homepage of the Friends app. Click the Social tile on Home, or say ‚ÄúXbox, go to Friends‚Äù to see who‚Äôs online and what they're up to. From there you can quickly send messages and get into a party.
[*][b]Party chat on by default. [/b]When you party up, chat audio is turned on by default.
[*][b]Chat with friends playing different games.[/b] Party chat is now separated from people playing your game, so you can chat with your friends who are online or you can chat with everyone playing the game.
[*][b]‚ÄúInvite friends to game‚Äù option available in your multiplayer titles.[/b] Similar to Xbox 360 titles, when you're inside a game's menu you have a simpler and quicker way to set up your multiplayer battles. Selecting ‚ÄúInvite friends‚Äù lets you invite friends to your game and party.
See a list of ‚ÄúRecent Players.‚Äù This is a simple list that shows you Xbox Live members you've recently played with, making it easier to stay in touch with people, add new friends after your multiplayer sessions, or report a player for bad behavior.
[*][b]Twitch live streaming support.[/b] The best broadcasting and spectating experience on any game console is on its way to Xbox One with the new Twitch app launching on March 11, just say ‚ÄúXbox broadcast‚Äù to start sharing.  Xbox One is the only next-gen console that allows you to archive your Twitch broadcasts and view live Twitch streams regardless of their original source.
[*][b]Dolby Digital sound.[/b] Optical out now supports 5.1 Dolby Digital, enabling devices such as sound bars and headsets with only optical in to be able to receive 5.1 Dolby Digital from Xbox One over optical. We're also adding support for Dolby Digital surround sound over HDMI. Now you'll be able to have the best sound quality no matter what speaker setup you are using.

[color=white][b]Venezuela Protests[/b][/color]
Venezuela is a country with a population of almost 30 million located on the northern coast of South America. The country comprises a continental mainland and numerous islands in the Caribbean Sea. It borders Guyana to the east, Brazil to the south, and Colombia to the west. The government of Venezuela is a socialist government and has had multiple uprising since it's official labeling in 1999. Opposition leaders are taking a common "regime-change" strategy in which it's people start riots and then they put the blame on the oppressive government as the cause.  The latest official numbers have eight confirmed deaths of opposition protesters, but no evidence that these were a result of efforts by the government to crush dissent. At least two pro-government people have also been killed, and two people on motorcycles were killed (one beheaded) by wires allegedly set up by protesters. Eleven of the 55 people currently detained for alleged crimes during protests are security officers.

[color=white][b]Crimea breaks ties with Ukraine[/b][/color]

Ukraine has considered this a direct invasion to their country and has activated all military forces, causing extremely high tension in the area. On the fourth of March, 2014 Crimea has officially broken ties with Ukraine, and asked all soldiers to leave their bases and urges them to join sides with the new Crimean government. The money that has been supporting the new government is from unknown sources and the separation hearing will be held later this month.

[color=white][b]Early Treatment Is Found to Clear H.I.V. in Babies[/b][/color]
A new aggressive drug treatment program has been shown to eradicate the life-threatening virus H.I.V. in newborn babies. The drug treatment was tested on two babies in the first 48 hours of life, and cured them of the virus without any additional medication following the procedure. Clinical trials are set to start in which 60 babies born infected will receive the aggressive drug treatment. If the drug treatment is found to be successful, over 250,000 new born babies can be treated and cured of the disease every year.

[color=white][b]Bacterial Spores Offer a New Source of Renewable Energy[/b][/color]
Bacillus spores shrivel up in dry times and bloat with a blast of humidity. Biophysicists at Columbia University realized this could be translated into energy. The spores can be put onto a flat piece of rubber, roughly the size of a human hand, and when in dry conditions, the spores bend the rubber into a curve. Humid air would then be pushed against the spores, which would make them release. This continuous cycle can provide renewable energy and has created the first spore-powered generator.

[color=white][b]N.A.S.A. Radar Demonstrates Ability to Foresee Sinkholes[/b][/color]
New analyses of N.A.S.A. radar data collected in 2012 indicate a huge sinkhole before it collapsed and caused the evacuation near Bayou Corne, La., last year. The findings suggest that if this data was to be collected regularly from airborne systems or satellites, it could foresee sinkholes before they collapse, decreasing danger to people and property. Sinkholes are depressions in the ground when the surface layers of the Earth collapse into caverns below. This data shows major ground deformations months before the sinkhole collapse. These deformations have previously been ignored as signs for sinkholes, but new data shows that they can precede sinkhole formations well in advance.

[color=white][b]Nasal Filter Looks Promising For Allergy Sufferers[/b][/color]
A nasal filter the size of a contact lens is able to block certain particles in the air, including pollen. A clinical study from Aarhus University concludes that this newly developed filter called 'Rhinix' appears to be significantly more effective against irritation and allergic reactions than a filterless placebo. Thus far, studies have also shown that Rhinix decreases nasal and throat irritation by upwards to 75%. A large-scale collaboration to test Rhinix is set to take place later this year. If Rhinix proves successful, it can help more than 500 million people worldwide suffering from pollen allergies.
